description: But, you can't set a timer for longer than 59 minutes.
... but some option to start multiple timers together would be nice.

This is amazing indeed. Even though the UI is simple but it is enough to serve as a pomodoro timer for me.
It would be great if the developer can add some statistic to the app
Didn't start up, can't say much more than that.
It works, but this is a very bad app for a 2019 version. Low quality and whats with the filesize?!
summary: Works but very low quality and way too big filesize

description:
It works fine. The app automatically gets minimized when you start a timer. A notification is shown and a "ding" sound is played when the timer runs out. It dings once every 30 seconds until you turn it off.

I like it. I think it's good for applying the pomodoro technique.

The usual snap dance:
- search for an app in the Snap Store
- half an hour later it might or might not show something vaguely related to the search
- install an app
- it may or may not install
- if it does, try an launch it
- zip happens
- uninstall the app
- swear that if Ubuntu continues to impose this ludicrous, already-failed, snap experiment, you will shift to a distribution that can still actually distribute apps that launch. Even sometimes work

does exactly what I expected, works without problems (ubuntu 18.04)
really helps remember about things I have to wait some time for
saw other reviews complain about it being too big but now it's 9.1MB

I'm so happy I got Snaps working again. THis tea timer is great and does exactly what I need: times tea and dings and notifies when it's done. It also periodically dings until you acknowledge it, in case you are distracted and miss it the first time.
A little too simple... no obvious way to delete a timer, no settings to adjust, i.e., to turn off the repeat beep.
I have installed four alarm clocks available at Ubuntu software and non of it is working properly. Missing sounds or adding time is very stupid way.

Set a time and a little bell goes "Ping" - something like an old toaster oven or an old analog microwave.

Very nice.

Although the lack of settings - is kind of disappointing, the inability to use a groovy MP3 as an audio and a slowly repeating "Ping" bell noise, means that it's not annoying, and I have to got to attend to it, rather than forgetting what I was supposed to be doing and grooving with the rhythm of the MP3. 

So kudos for simplicity and a functional "does what it says" program.
On Ubuntu 20.04 works great. The coolest thing is that the app shows progress bar while in tray. Sound also works at the end.
summary: Great app as reminder for short brakes during the day

description: Es wäre doch sicher nicht verkehrt, der App auch etwas zweckentfremdung zuzulassen. So ist beispielsweise keine Zeit über 1 Stunden planbar, was echt schade ist. Es hätte ja gereicht, wenn man wenigstens bis 99 Minuten hätte planen können. Aber bei 59 ist leider Schluß.
summary: simpler Aufbau, aber leider keine Zeit über 1 Std planbar

description: Muy buena aplicación, sencilla y practica.

Un minuteur simple à configuer, où on peut garder des temps prédéfinis en mémoire.
Il ne redémarre pas tout seul.
Le son passe sur mon ordinateur et il y a une notification sur l'écran.
